channel.title: Auxy 5.1.0 Update/Feedback
channel.description:
[See what's new below...](https://disco.auxy.co/t/auxy-5-1-0-update/9526/5?u=lenberg)
So, some significant UI changes that look like they'll improve workflow.
Great to have the Scene View remain open and usable now. That'll put to rest one major frustration. Thanks. :+1:
Some nice extra touches too, such as the animations within the pattern tiles while playing.
How to bring up arrangement mode wasn't super clear. I was briefly panicked that you'd somehow forgotten to make it possible. Didn't immediately spot that the Loop label is interactive (black underline on dark grey background? Barely visible, even on max brightness).
Disappointed not to see track duration added. Hopefully, next update. :)
  But, overall, some welcome updates and some nice new touches. A good step forward, imo. :+1: :)

item.title: Auxy 5.1.0 Update/Feedback
item.dc:creator: W7SEGUY
item.description:
Hi, after updating I noticed that the creator name still gets overwritten. For example: Project A is made by “W7SEGUY” and Project B is done by “Billy”, but when I go from Project A to Project B and look up the creator name it says “W7SEGUY” instead of “Billy”. Then when I type in “Billy” in Project B and switch back to Project A to check the creator name its says “Billy” when it already should be “W7SEGUY”.

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy 5.1.0 Update/Feedback
item.dc:creator: Davis9754
item.description:
I think this update looks cool, because I brought the premium version a few days after I update the app to 5.1, and I created a good song! But I kind of feel worried because all the original sounds are getting locked except for pasta and egg for those who don’t have any packs. My brother always uses freak in all of his songs, and now he might be unable to create auxy songs because freak is not a demo sound. I was just expecting the current demo sounds to be added on with the original sounds in the demo sounds list.

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy 5.1.0 Update/Feedback
item.dc:creator: MisterMaster
item.description:
Yeah, instruments, for a short while could be dragged up and down. Then, it was switched back to the menu options for one “hop” at a time. Not sure why it was reverted, because having to move up row by row is inefficient and requires multiple UI interactions, compared to a simple drag and drop.

I presume there was a reason they removed the drag approach.

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy 5.1.0 Update/Feedback
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
I’m talking about rearranging instruments.

I think most users find moving instruments up/down within a project frustrating.

The current approach (Contextual menu: ‘Move up’/‘Move down’) and its limit of moving only one position at a time is painfully awkward and slow.

They should unify ‘move’ behaviours on the drag n drop method used for rearranging loops/patterns/automations as well as moving scenes around within the arrangement bar.

It’s a far superior method and significantly more reflective of conventions on touch devices.

 
(I never really know what to call various parts of the UI.
‘Scenes’, to me, are the units within the arrangement bar.)

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy 5.1.0 Update/Feedback

If you want to move a scene from one instrument to another, just hold it and press “move.” Then you can drag it to the instrument of your choice.

Auxy already has a great interface for moving

I think most users find moving instruments up/down within a project frustrating.
I certainly wish they’d find a way to make it as easy as moving loops or scenes - i.e. drag and drop.

item.title: Auxy 5.1.0 Update/Feedback
item.dc:creator: Db909
item.description:
Yeah I guess the bottom line is that any of the following or some combination thereof would be useful functions to have and perhaps save folks some time and organization:

“Delete Unused Loops”
“Delete Unused Automations”
“Delete All Loops”
“Delete All Automations”

The talk of templates brings to my mind the idea of having all loops stored globally in addition to within their project of origin. That may not be quite the thing, but I’m thinking people are wanting templates so they can get going quickly and perhaps already have their favorite standard drum loop or similar already there so they can either use it as is or tweak to taste rather than starting from scratch. And we already have the ability to copy instruments with their loops from one project to another. With that in mind, why not let people search and browse or maybe even hit a random button to choose loops from any project. This is probably impossible with the cloud storage and all that. But I mean Auxy already has a great interface for moving, mixing, and matching within a single project, that’s probably one of its greatest strengths, what about across projects? The effect would be of using one of those pre made loop apps to make music, where you’re just browsing and putting it together, only this time the loops would be your own originals. Totally spitballing here don’t get me wrong

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy 5.1.0 Update/Feedback
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
A “Clear All Loops” utility function…

Kinda dovetails/overlaps with an existing request for a ‘Delete all unused loops and automations’ function, primarily aimed at cleaning up at the end of a production.

If ‘Delete unused…’ was supported, it would offer a quick route to your scenario too.
You’d effectively delete the arrangement, then use it.

Otherwise, your proposal doesn’t really appear to offer much over creating/using templates.
Unless I’m missing something.

While, as you say, it’s not currently possible to create automations for an instrument unless there’s at least one pattern, it’s currently possible to delete all patterns for an instrument, leaving just the automations.

So, while it takes a little setting up, you can have your templates with automations now.

If formal templates are something they’d consider, then a checkbox in the project naming screen would make sense - and would be a good route to what you’re describing.

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy 5.1.0 Update/Feedback
item.dc:creator: Db909
item.description:
I agree the chromatic setting could be persistent. There’s really no reason not to, but if the issue is primarily one of saving time, time you don’t spend setting up all the little bitty details, AND if a fully customizable template system is too tall an order (we can likely assume), i offer a third solution:

A “Clear All Loops” utility function in the settings. So you can simply go into any project of yours or any project that’s been shared with you, and with the press of a button, clear out all the loops while keeping everything else as is: same instruments loaded up, same tempo, same SCALE/CHROMATIC SETTINGS, etc. This could save butt loads of time. You’d have a sonic palette all ready to go.

This would also clear automations presumably because you can’t add an automation without a loop right now. However it would be a whole lot of fun if this were not the case and there was a “clear all automations” function as well, so you could choose which to clear. Think of having a cleared out project with your sounds set up, no loops, but with automations. You could compose new music into existing automations, and that would be super inspiring and probably speed up everyone’s workflow because as you know, the sounds left completely dry and untouched, are, well, they are static and such. I think that’d be a really exciting way to begin new projects.

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy 5.1.0 Update/Feedback
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
are you saying with your idea that each new project would default to the key setting you last used?

Scale mode, not key.
As I work in a Chromatic, and have never yet tuned my drums, the Key setting is irrelevant to my workflow.
(I couldn’t tell you what key any of my stuff uses.)

This could prove rather annoying for me, because I switch around between major, minor, and chromatic quite a bit so it would be kind of random every time I start a new project.

Do you start every project or most projects in a Minor Scale by choice?
If not, you’ll still have the same ‘1 in 3’ chance of having the Scale you want each time you start a new project.

If, for some reason, you still prefer to start in a specific Scale, then perhaps allowing us to choose our default Scale, rather than simply using the last setting would be the better solution.

Those who prefers Minor simply leave the default setting on Minor.

The reason I opt for Chromatic is because I’m free to write in any scale without the need to touch Scale settings.

Read full topic

Ok yeah sure. Personally it doesn’t seem to inhibit my creative flow much, but I suppose we each have our own individual pet peeves. I could be misunderstanding you, but are you saying with your idea that each new project would default to the key setting you last used? This could prove rather annoying for me, because I switch around between major, minor, and chromatic quite a bit so it would be kind of random every time I start a new project.

item.description:
akabillposters:

(I do believe the current non-persistent approach to the Scale setting is poor UX, so would like to see that changed to better support workflow personalization, regardless of whether they added a user template feature or not.)

It most certainly is, but for them it isn’t. And there lies the reason why we need more transparency.

item.title: Auxy 5.1.0 Update/Feedback
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
I can certainly see how user templates would be useful and popular - especially to those who are a bit more keen about good workflows.

Wouldn’t call it a ‘compromise’ though. Adding support for even a basic formal template workflow goes far beyond the work required to make the Scale setting persistent.

(I do believe the current non-persistent approach to the Scale setting is poor UX, so would like to see that changed to better support workflow personalisation, regardless of whether they added a user template feature or not.)

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy 5.1.0 Update/Feedback
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
akabillposters:

We’re repeatedly told that this app isn’t aimed at beginners - and yet, there’s no real accommodation to users who don’t want or need training wheels.

Do you think that templates, like the idea I just thought of when creating new projects (as in NOT copying a project but having a saved “template” project that could have the process done when you click the new project window and select it) would be a compromise? It definitely would be a great step, and theoretically wouldn’t be something out of the ordinary to suggest nor implement.

spoiler

Read full topic

item.title: Auxy 5.1.0 Update/Feedback
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
A little bit more than that, but that’s not the point.
It’s frustrating and those seconds of recurring frustration add up. And that’s where 3-star reviews come from.

I often leap into creating, forgetting that I need to change the setting. That interruption breaks the flow and has me cursing the app - every time.

Now multiply that by however many users find being pushed into a Minor Scale for every new project frustrating.

That’s potentially hundreds of user hours wasted for the lack of a few minutes of coding. Heck, I alone have probably wasted more total time switching to Chromatic than it takes to code a better solution.

We’re repeatedly told that this app isn’t aimed at beginners - and yet, there’s no real accommodation to users who don’t want or need training wheels. This issue is a small, but perfect example.

Read full topic
